messages.original: Three Israeli airstrikes targeted the Ali Al-Taher area near Nabatiyeh, southern Lebanon just now.

The IDF released footage showing two of the Israeli airstrikes on a hill in the Ali Al-Taher area of southern Lebanon yesterday. They stated that they were targeting Hezbollah military infrastructure, including underground infrastructure.

6+ Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Liski Railway Station in Voronezh Oblast last night. At least 1 impact was recorded, resulting in a fire breaking out.
Geolocation
: 50.976866, 39.511337.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Varachyne, Yunakivka direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~62.
Total land area: ~0.30km¬≤.
(Note: This advance likely happened weeks ago, but was only just recently confirmed).

Russian forces have captured the village of Serebryanka, northeastern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~1,110.
Total land area: ~3.33km¬≤.
While this does complicate the situation for Ukraine in Siversk significantly, the tactical heights to the south of Serebryanka are more crucial.

Footage showing 4 new Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a communication tower, and a long-range UAV control relay near the villages of Kholmy and Mamekyne.
2 strikes on a communication tower: 51.86761, 32.56485.
2 strikes on a UAV control relay: 52.10944, 33.21277.

Last night, a massive Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 35 drones attacked various targets in the region, including in Dobropillya, Sviatohorivka, Myrove, Novovodyane and Kramatorsk.

Last night, a massive Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 35 drones attacked various targets in the region, including in Dobropillya, Sviatohorivka, Myrove, Novovodyane and Kramatorsk.

As a result of new Russian advances in the Siversk, Lyman, Dobropillya, and Bilozerske directions, the Donetsk OVA has announced mandatory evacuation orders for families with children in 38 different settlements in Donetsk Oblast since August 8. 
Among these settlements are the cities of Druzhkivka and Bilozerske. Additionally, 3 villages not in their announced list are being evacuated, and the city of Lyman is now under an evacuation order for all civilians. 
The purple line on the map represents the current evacuation zones, and the yellow markers represent the settlements added to the evacuation zone since August 8.
There is some truth to the Deepstate and Azov claims it seems

Syria Still Has Uragan Heavy Rocket Launchers
Syria is still in possession of Soviet-made BM-27 Uragan heavy multiple rocket launchers, according to a photo that surfaced online on August 16.
Some activists said that the photo was taken close to Syria‚Äôs border with Lebanon in western Syria. However, others alleged that the photo was taken close to the front with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces in the east of the country.
The photo shows a single Uragan, but activists who were first to share it said that multiple launchers were passing by in the area at the time.
The Uragan 220 mm launcher can fire high explosive fragmentation, cluster or mine laying rockets. The effective firing range of the system is 35 kilometers. The rockets can reach a maximum firing range of around 90 kilometers, although they lose all accuracy.

European Bureaucrats Are In Rush To Sabotage Any Prospects Of Peace Following Trump-Putin Talks
The negotiations between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin at Elmendorf-Richardson military base in Alaska marked a pivotal event in international diplomacy. The meeting, held in a "three-on-three" format (Russian delegation: Putin, Lavrov, Ushakov; U.S. delegation: Trump, Rubio, Whitcoff), lasted a record-breaking 2 hours and 45 minutes ‚Äì longer than any previous Russia-U.S. summits in recent years. The atmosphere, as assessed by CNN, was far from cold: a handshake on the tarmac, a joint ride in the US presidential limousine "The Beast," and even Trump applauding Putin.
Meanwhile, European bureaucrats are in rush to sabotage any prospects of peace settlement. While Putin and Trump sought paths to de-escalation, London and Brussels activated mechanisms aimed at cementing division and militarization of the region.
Read more 
HERE

Behind Diplomacy: Russia‚Äôs Relentless Strikes Destroy Ukrainian Shelters
Despite high-level talks between Presidents Putin and Trump, Russian forces conducted another series of precision strikes across Ukraine overnight, demonstrating Moscow‚Äôs ability to sustain military operations while engaging in diplomacy. The attacks focused on military infrastructure, command centers, and foreign mercenary positions.
According to the Ukrainian military, in total, a barrage of 85 Geran-type attack drones accompanied by decoy UAVs and an Iskander-M ballistic missile were launched, with Ukrainian air defense allegedly managed to intercept 61 targets. However, successful strikes were recorded at multiple locations, inflicting significant damage on Ukrainian military capabilities.

From Donbass to Dnepropetrovsk: Russian Troops Expand Strategic Foothold in New Region
Russian troops have secured another strategic victory in Ukraine‚Äôs Dnepropetrovsk region, with the ‚ÄúVostok‚Äù (East) military grouping liberating the village of Voronoe in a coordinated offensive operation. This marks the third settlement freed in the region following earlier successes at Malievka and Yanvarskoe, demonstrating Moscow‚Äôs growing momentum along this entire sector of the front.
The 5th Guards Tank Brigade of Russia‚Äôs 36th Army spearheaded the assault, combining artillery barrages with precision drone strikes to dislodge entrenched Ukrainian forces from the 110th Mechanized Brigade. After softening defenses with sustained fire, Russian assault teams moved in to mop up buildings, basements, and surrounding tree lines, eliminating remaining resistance. Ukrainian forces reportedly suffered battalion-level casualties during the fighting.

Russian Army Charges Forward In Donetsk, Claims Two More Villages 
The Russian military continued its advance in the Donetsk direction on August 16, making additional gains and inflicting some heavy losses on Kiev forces.
In its daily briefing, the Russian Ministry of Defense said that the Zapad [West] Group of Forces had liberated the village of Kolodezi, which is located just under ten kilometers to the northeast of the key city of Lyman.
The group also attacked two mechanized brigades and one motorized infantry brigade of Kiev forces near the villages of Karpovka, Shandrigolovo, and Sredneye in Donetsk, as well as close to the towns of Borovskaya Andreyevka, Kupyansk, Osinovo, Peschanoye, Petropavlovka in the Kharkiv direction, according to the ministry.
Ukrainian losses in these directions amounted to 230 troops, one British-made Mastiff armored vehicle, one Novator armored fighting vehicle, 14 motor vehicles.

Israel Bolster Air Defenses In Preparations Of Second War With Iran 
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) is accelerating plans to strengthen its multi-layered defense capabilities in anticipation of a new war with Iran or more missile attacks by the Houthis in Yemen, Walla News reported on August 15.
According to the Hebrew news site, Director General of the Defense Ministry, Maj. Gen. Amir Baram, has ordered the expedited development and production of air defense systems, including the Arrow 3, Arrow 4, Iron Dome, David‚Äôs Sling, and a ground-based laser system.
Read more: 
HERE

U.S. Deploys 4,000 Troops, Carrier, Submarine And More On Counter-Cartel Mission 
CNN on August 15 provided more details about the United States‚Äô recent decision to deploy air and naval forces to Latin America and the Caribbean to address the threat posed by drug cartels.
The deployment was first reported by Reuters a day earlier. It came in as a part of the efforts the administration of President Donald Trump is making to counter drug trafficking into the U.S.
In a first step, the U.S. designated last February Mexico‚Äôs Sinaloa Cartel and other drug gangs as well as Venezuelan criminal group Tren de Aragua as global terrorist organizations. A report from The New York Times released earlier this month alleged that Trump had secretly signed a directive to begin using military force against the groups.
Read more: 
HERE

Israeli Navy Attacks Power Plant Near Yemen‚Äôs Sanaa 
The Israeli Navy early on August 17 launched strikes against a power plant located south of the Yemeni capital, Sanaa, which is held by the Houthis (Ansar Allah).
In a statement, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) said that the strikes hit ‚Äúenergy infrastructure used by the Houthi terror regime,‚Äù near Sanaa, in response to ‚Äúrepeated attacks by the Houthi terror regime against the State of Israel and its citizens, including the launching of surface-to-surface missiles and UAVs toward Israeli territory.‚Äù
The Al-Masirah TV, which is run by the Houthis, said that the Hezyaz power plant was subjected to ‚Äúan American-Israeli aggression.‚Äù
The channel later reported that workers and firefighters had put out a fire caused by the attack, and that work to repair the damage was underway.
